Definition: Semicolon-separated list of (internal) study identifiers (cross-referencing to study worksheet) for which the variable was observed.

Code used to identify the variable in the data file. We recommend using a variable definition from the Crop Ontology where possible. Otherwise, the Crop Ontology naming convention is recommended: <trait abbreviation>_<method abbreviation>_<scale abbreviation>). A variable ID must be unique within a given investigation.

Example: Anthesis computed in growing degree days

Definition: Accession number of the variable in the Crop Ontology
Name of the (plant or environmental) trait under observation
Accession number of the trait in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).
Format: Term from Plant Trait Ontology, Crop Ontology, or XML Environment Ontology

Definition: Name of the method of observation
Accession number of the method in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).
Format: Term from Plant Trait Ontology, Crop Ontology, or XML Environment Ontology

Definition: Textual description of the method, which may extend a method defined in an external reference with specific parameters, e.g. growth stage, inoculation precise organ (leaf number)
Example:
Days to anthesis for male flowering was measured in thermal time (GDD: growing degree-days) according to Ritchie J, NeSmith D (1991;Temperature and crop development. Modeling plant and soil systems American Society of Agronomy Madison, Wisconsin USA) with TBASE=8�C and T0=30�C.
Plant height was measured at 5 years with a ruler, one year after Botritis inoculation.

Definition: URI/DOI of reference describing the method.
Name of the scale associated with the variable
Accession number of the scale in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology).
Name of the scale or unit of time with which observations of this type were recorded in the data file (for time series studies).
